article.headline: FTs help Trojans avoid first-round upset
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Herbert Evans and Ryan Heck each made critical free throws in the final 1:04 as Troy State won its 12th straight game by holding off Florida Atlantic 85-82 Thursday in the opening game of the Atlantic Sun Conference tournament. Evans led the Trojans (23-5) with 23 points on 7 of 12 shooting, including 4 of 6 attempts from 3-point range. Troy State, the top seed, will play the winner of the Georgia State-Stetson game on Friday. Florida Atlantic (9-19) led for much of the first half, only to fall behind by 14 points, 70-56, after a Troy State run in the second half. The Owls battled back and pulled within a point, 83-82, on a free throw by Wes Edwards, who finished with 13 points. Florida Atlantic had a final chance to tie the game, but a 3-pointer by Mike Bell was short and a desperation shot by Earnest Crumbley was late and off the mark. Crumbley led the Owls with 22 points. The two teams combined to set a conference tournament record by making 27 3-pointers. Kendrick Johnson added 20 points and Heck came off the bench to score 16 for Troy State. Jimmy Bishop finished with 17 points for the Owls.
